links.description: Add a user to an existing group.
links.title: Add

_88username.description: MMS username

___groupId.description: The groupId in which the user has the specified role. Note that for the “global” roles (those whose name starts with GLOBAL_) there is no groupId since these roles are not tied to a group.

_88password.description: Password. This field is NOT included in the entity returned from the server. It can only be sent in the entity body when creating a new user.

_88mobileNumber.description: Mobile number. This field can only be set or edited using the MMS UI because it is tied to two factor authentication

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this host.

_88uptimeMsec.description: Number of milliseconds since this host's last restart.

_88password.description: Password for connecting to this host. If a host's authMechanismName is MONGODB_CR, then you must include this field when creating the host or updating its credentials. However, it will never be exposed when a host entity is returned.

_88logsEnabled.description: Is MMS collecting logs for this host?

_88muninPort.description: What port should be used to collect Munin stats from this host?

_88lastRestart.description: Date this host was last restarted.

_88hostEnabled.description: Is this host currently enabled? Hosts can be manually disabled in the MMS UI.

_88muninEnabled.description: Are Munin stats being collected for this host?

_88hostname.description: Primary hostname. A host typically has several aliases, so the primary is the best available name as decided by MMS.

_88lastReactivated.description: The last time this has was manually reactivated.

_88replicaSetName.description: Name of the replica set this host belongs to. Only present if this host is part of a replica set.

_88replicaStateName.description: Current state of this host within a replica set. Only present if this host is part of a replica set.

_88deactivated.description: Has this host been deactivated by MMS? A host will be marked as deactivated when MMS hasn't received a ping from it in several days.

_88created.description: Date this host was created or first discovered by MMS.

_88lowUlimit.description: Does this host have a low ulimit setting?

_88username.description: Username for connecting to this host. Only present when the authMechanismName is MONGODB_CR.

_88version.description: Version of MongoDB running on this host.

_88journalingEnabled.description: Is journaling enabled for this host?

_88port.description: Port that MongoDB process (mongod or mongos) listens on.

_88authMechanismName.description: The authentication mechanism used to connect to this host.

_88shardName.description: Name of the shard this host belongs to. Only present if the host is part of a sharded cluster.

_88lastPing.description: When the last ping for this host was received.

_88sslEnabled.description: Is SSL enabled for this host?

_88alertsEnabled.description: Are alerts enabled for this host?

_88hidden.description: Is this host currently hidden? When MMS deactivates a host, it will also mark it as hidden.

_88profilerEnabled.description: Is MMS collecting profile information from this host?

_88hasStartupWarnings.description: Are there startup warnings for this host?

_88units.description: The units in which the metric values are expressed.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this host.

_88granularity.description: The size of the epoch covered by each data point.

_88period.description: The ISO-8601 formatted time period that specifies how far back in the past to query.

_88databaseName.description: The name of the database. Only present for database-level metrics.

_88dataPoints.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a single metric data point. When there is no data point available for a particular epoch, then it will simply be missing from the array. For example, if you request minute-level data points for 1:30PM through 2:00PM, but MMS does not have a 1:31PM sample, then: dataPoints[0].timestamp = ‘...T13:30:00Z’; dataPoints[1].timestamp = ‘...T13:32:00Z’; dataPoints[2].timestamp = ‘...T13:33:00Z’; etc.

___timestamp.description: The timestamp of the beginning of the epoch represented by this data point.

___value.description: The value of the data point.

_88hostId.description: ID of the host to which this metric pertains.

_88deviceName.description: The name of the device. Only present for hardware (ie, Munin) metrics.

$eref.description: Name of the shard this host belongs to. Only present if the host is part of a sharded cluster.
The last time this has was manually reactivated.
Has this host been deactivated by MMS? A host will be marked as deactivated when MMS hasn't received a ping from it in several days.
Is MMS collecting profile information from this host?
What port should be used to collect Munin stats from this host?
Date this host was created or first discovered by MMS.
Version of MongoDB running on this host.

Password for connecting to this host. If a host's authMechanismName is MONGODB_CR, then you must include this field when creating the host or updating its credentials. However, it will never be exposed when a host entity is returned.
Is MMS collecting logs for this host?
Primary hostname. A host typically has several aliases, so the primary is the best available name as decided by MMS.
Are alerts enabled for this host?
Name of the replica set this host belongs to. Only present if this host is part of a replica set.
Is journaling enabled for this host?
Current state of this host within a replica set. Only present if this host is part of a replica set.
Number of milliseconds since this host's last restart.
The authentication mechanism used to connect to this host.
When the last ping for this host was received.
Date this host was last restarted.
ID of the group that owns this host.
Is this host currently enabled? Hosts can be manually disabled in the MMS UI.
Is SSL enabled for this host?
Are Munin stats being collected for this host?
Does this host have a low ulimit setting?
Is this host currently hidden? When MMS deactivates a host, it will also mark it as hidden.
Username for connecting to this host. Only present when the authMechanismName is MONGODB_CR.
Port that MongoDB process (mongod or mongos) listens on.
Are there startup warnings for this host?

_88units.description: The units in which the metric values are expressed.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this host.

_88granularity.description: The size of the epoch covered by each data point.

_88period.description: The ISO-8601 formatted time period that specifies how far back in the past to query.

_88databaseName.description: The name of the database. Only present for database-level metrics.

_88dataPoints.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a single metric data point. When there is no data point available for a particular epoch, then it will simply be missing from the array. For example, if you request minute-level data points for 1:30PM through 2:00PM, but MMS does not have a 1:31PM sample, then: dataPoints[0].timestamp = ‘...T13:30:00Z’; dataPoints[1].timestamp = ‘...T13:32:00Z’; dataPoints[2].timestamp = ‘...T13:33:00Z’; etc.

___timestamp.description: The timestamp of the beginning of the epoch represented by this data point.

___value.description: The value of the data point.

_88hostId.description: ID of the host to which this metric pertains.

_88deviceName.description: The name of the device. Only present for hardware (ie, Munin) metrics.

$eref.description: The units in which the metric values are expressed.

An array of objects, where each object represents a single metric data point. When there is no data point available for a particular epoch, then it will simply be missing from the array. For example, if you request minute-level data points for 1:30PM through 2:00PM, but MMS does not have a 1:31PM sample, then: dataPoints[0].timestamp = ‘...T13:30:00Z’; dataPoints[1].timestamp = ‘...T13:32:00Z’; dataPoints[2].timestamp = ‘...T13:33:00Z’; etc.

___timestamp.description: The timestamp of the beginning of the epoch represented by this data point.

___value.description: The value of the data point.

The name of the database. Only present for database-level metrics.
The size of the epoch covered by each data point.
ID of the host to which this metric pertains.

links.description: List existing alerts for specified alert config.
links.title: List

_88created.description: When the alert was opened.

_88status.description: The current state of the alert. Possible values are: OPEN CLOSED

_88lastNotified.description: When the last notification was sent for this alert. Only present if notifications have been sent.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that this alert was opened for.

_88acknowledgingUsername.description: The username of the user who acknowledged the alert. Will not be present if the alert has never been acknowledged.

_88eventTypeName.description: The name of the event that triggered the alert. The possible values here depend on the typeName.

_88acknowledgementComment.description: The comment left by the user who acknowledged the alert. Will not be present if the alert has never been acknowledged.

_88resolved.description: When the alert was closed. Only present if the status is CLOSED.

_88acknowledgedUntil.description: The date through which the alert has been acknowledged. Will not be present if the alert has never been acknowledged.

_88updated.description: When the alert was last updated.

_88created.description: When this alert configuration was created.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this alert configuration.

_88matcher.description: Rules to apply when matching an object against this alert configuration. Only entities that match all these rules will be checked for an alert condition.

___fieldName.description: The name of the field in the target object to match on. The available fields depend on the typeName.

___value.description: The value to test with the specified operator. When matching on the TYPE_NAME field for a HOST or HOST_METRIC alert, the possible typeName values are: PRIMARY SECONDARY STANDALONE CONFIG MONGOS

___operator.description: The operator to test the field's value.

_88updated.description: When this alert configuration was last updated.

_88notification.description: Notifications to send when an alert condition is detected.

___emailAddress.description: The email address to which to send notification. Only present for notifications of type EMAIL.

___notificationToken.description: A HipChat API token. Only present for notifications of type HIP_CHAT.

___typeName.description: The type of alert notification. Note that SNMP notifications are not available in the cloud version of MMS. This feature is only available to On Premise installations.

___intervalMin.description: The number of minutes to wait between succcessive notifications for unacknowledged alerts that are not resolved.

___delayMin.description: The number of minutes to wait after an alert condition is detected before sending out the first notification.

___emailEnabled.description: Should email notifications be sent? Only present for notifications of type GROUP and USER.

___roomName.description: HipChat room name. Only present for notifications of type HIP_CHAT.

___username.description: The name of an MMS user to which to send notifications. Only a user in the group that owns the alert configuration is allowed here.

___snmpAddress.description: Hostname and port to send SNMP traps to. Note that SNMP is only supported for On Premise MMS; also, at this time MMS is only able to send SNMP traps to the standard SNMP port (161).

___smsEnabled.description: Should SMS notifications be sent? Only present for notifications of type GROUP and USER.

___mobileNumber.description: Mobile number to send SMS messages to. Only present for notifications of type SMS.

___threshold.description: The threshold value outside of which an alert will be triggered.

___mode.description: The mode to use when computing the current metric value.

___operator.description: The operator to apply when checking the current metric value against the threshold value.

_88username.description: MMS username

___groupId.description: The groupId in which the user has the specified role. Note that for the “global” roles (those whose name starts with GLOBAL_) there is no groupId since these roles are not tied to a group.

_88password.description: Password. This field is NOT included in the entity returned from the server. It can only be sent in the entity body when creating a new user.

_88mobileNumber.description: Mobile number. This field can only be set or edited using the MMS UI because it is tied to two factor authentication

_88units.description: The units in which the metric values are expressed.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this host.

_88granularity.description: The size of the epoch covered by each data point.

_88period.description: The ISO-8601 formatted time period that specifies how far back in the past to query.

_88databaseName.description: The name of the database. Only present for database-level metrics.

_88dataPoints.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a single metric data point. When there is no data point available for a particular epoch, then it will simply be missing from the array. For example, if you request minute-level data points for 1:30PM through 2:00PM, but MMS does not have a 1:31PM sample, then: dataPoints[0].timestamp = ‘...T13:30:00Z’; dataPoints[1].timestamp = ‘...T13:32:00Z’; dataPoints[2].timestamp = ‘...T13:33:00Z’; etc.

___timestamp.description: The timestamp of the beginning of the epoch represented by this data point.

___value.description: The value of the data point.

_88deviceName.description: The name of the device. Only present for hardware (ie, Munin) metrics.

_88created.description: When the alert was opened.

_88status.description: The current state of the alert. Possible values are: OPEN CLOSED

_88lastNotified.description: When the last notification was sent for this alert. Only present if notifications have been sent.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that this alert was opened for.

_88acknowledgingUsername.description: The username of the user who acknowledged the alert. Will not be present if the alert has never been acknowledged.

_88eventTypeName.description: The name of the event that triggered the alert. The possible values here depend on the typeName.

_88acknowledgementComment.description: The comment left by the user who acknowledged the alert. Will not be present if the alert has never been acknowledged.

_88resolved.description: When the alert was closed. Only present if the status is CLOSED.

_88acknowledgedUntil.description: The date through which the alert has been acknowledged. Will not be present if the alert has never been acknowledged.

_88updated.description: When the alert was last updated.

_88typeName.description: Specifies what kind of cluster this is.

_88clusterName.description: Display name of the cluster. Only applies to sharded clusters. Note that mongod itself doesn't allow you to name a cluster; this name is supplied by (and editable within) MMS. For a replica set within a sharded cluster, the cluster name is the name of its parent cluster.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this cluster.

_88replicaSetName.description: Name of the replica set. Only present for a cluster of type REPLICA_SET.

_88lastHeartbeat.description: The approximate last time MMS processed a ping from this cluster.

_88shardName.description: Name of the shard. Only present for a cluster of type SHARDED or REPLICA_SET that is part of a sharded cluster.

_88activeAgentCount.description: Number of monitoring agents sending regular pings to MMS.

_88publicApiEnabled.description: Is the Public API enabled for this group? This is a read-only field that will always be true for groups created with the API. Note that for groups created in the MMS UI, the only way to set this flag to true is by enabling the Public API for the group in the Settings tab.

_88lastActiveAgent.description: Date that a ping was last received from one of the group's monitoring agents.

_88replicaSetCount.description: Total number of replica sets for this group.

_88shardCount.description: Total number of shards for this group.

_88hostsCounts.description: The total number of hosts by type. The embedded fields should be self-explanatory.

_88throttling.description: Tells whether or not MMS is throttling data. This can be used as a simple indicator of the current health of MMS, since throttling is generally enabled when MMS is in an unhealthy state.

_88groupId.description: ID of the group that owns this host.

_88uptimeMsec.description: Number of milliseconds since this host's last restart.

_88password.description: Password for connecting to this host. If a host's authMechanismName is MONGODB_CR, then you must include this field when creating the host or updating its credentials. However, it will never be exposed when a host entity is returned.

_88logsEnabled.description: Is MMS collecting logs for this host?

_88muninPort.description: What port should be used to collect Munin stats from this host?

_88lastRestart.description: Date this host was last restarted.

_88hostEnabled.description: Is this host currently enabled? Hosts can be manually disabled in the MMS UI.

_88muninEnabled.description: Are Munin stats being collected for this host?

_88hostname.description: Primary hostname. A host typically has several aliases, so the primary is the best available name as decided by MMS.

_88lastReactivated.description: The last time this has was manually reactivated.

_88replicaSetName.description: Name of the replica set this host belongs to. Only present if this host is part of a replica set.

_88replicaStateName.description: Current state of this host within a replica set. Only present if this host is part of a replica set.

_88deactivated.description: Has this host been deactivated by MMS? A host will be marked as deactivated when MMS hasn't received a ping from it in several days.

_88created.description: Date this host was created or first discovered by MMS.

_88lowUlimit.description: Does this host have a low ulimit setting?

_88username.description: Username for connecting to this host. Only present when the authMechanismName is MONGODB_CR.

_88version.description: Version of MongoDB running on this host.

_88journalingEnabled.description: Is journaling enabled for this host?

_88port.description: Port that MongoDB process (mongod or mongos) listens on.

_88authMechanismName.description: The authentication mechanism used to connect to this host.

_88shardName.description: Name of the shard this host belongs to. Only present if the host is part of a sharded cluster.

_88lastPing.description: When the last ping for this host was received.

_88sslEnabled.description: Is SSL enabled for this host?

_88alertsEnabled.description: Are alerts enabled for this host?

_88hidden.description: Is this host currently hidden? When MMS deactivates a host, it will also mark it as hidden.

_88profilerEnabled.description: Is MMS collecting profile information from this host?

_88hasStartupWarnings.description: Are there startup warnings for this host?

_88created.description: The date this IP address was added to the whitelist.

_88count.description: The total number of requests that originated from this IP address. Note that this field is only updated when a resource that is protected by the whitelist is accessed.

_88lastUsed.description: The date of the most recent request that originated from this IP address. Note that this field is only updated when a resource that is protected by the whitelist is accessed.
